{{knowledge objective |Identifiant=OIC-351-10-A |Item_parent=Agitation and acute delirium |Item_parent_short=Agitation and acute delirium |Rank=A |Title=Knowing the indications and implementation of complementary examinations in the context of agitation |Description=None |Rubric=Management |Contributors= |Order=10}} == '''Systematic examinations''' == * Minimum biological work-up: blood glucose, ionogram, blood calcium, CBC, CRP, coagulation test (for possible IM injection). * ECG (for possible antipsychotic treatment, search for long QT)
== '''On the basis of the history and clinical examination findings:''' == * Blood alcohol * Urinary toxicology * Liver function tests * Renal function * TSH US * Cerebral imaging * Lumbar puncture * EEG * ECBU * Thick Gout * Chest X-ray

question.title: What is typically performed as a minimum biological work-up in the context of agitation?

option_a.title: Blood alcohol and liver function tests

correct_option.title: A
correct_option.description: The letter of the correct option
